meanings.definition: A person who shares equally in an inheritance.
meanings.sent1: In the will, each parcener received an equal portion of the family's land.
meanings.sent2: The siblings became parceners after their parents passed away, dividing the estate equally.
meanings.sent3: At the family gathering, the parcener joked about inheriting the old family heirlooms.
meanings.sent4: Being a parcener felt like holding a piece of the family's history in their hands.
meanings.sent5: The parcener proudly displayed the inherited antique jewelry.

meanings.definition: To inherit or receive an equal share of an estate with others.
meanings.sent1: When the uncle passed away, the siblings had to parcener the large estate.
meanings.sent2: She will parcener the family farm with her cousins according to the will.
meanings.sent3: The lawyer explained how they would parcener the assets among the relatives.
meanings.sent4: The responsibility to parcener the inheritance fell on the eldest sibling.
meanings.sent5: They decided to parcener the antique collection fairly among themselves.
